features.name: Crop Interact
features.desc: Right-Clicking on crops will do all the work of harvesting for you!! Right clicking (empty hand or not!) will earn you not only the original drop of the crop, but even some of the bonus seeds that you'd normally get (minus one, of course, to account for what's been re-planted for you). Works with most plantables, assuming they follow similar code to Vanilla.

features.name: Cake Drop
features.desc: Breaking a completely un-eaten cake will drop itself. Finally you can have your cake and eat it too!

features.name: Tree Falling
features.desc: Trees actually fall down when breaking their trunk, based off of Tersnip's ChopDown Mod!

features.name: Torch Lighing
features.desc: Right-clicking a torch (or anything tagged `#vtweaks:ignition_item`) onto any block which can be lit (furnaces, redstone ore, campfires and anything not tagged `#vtweaks:torch_ignition_blacklist`) will ignite it!

features.name: Durability Tooltips
features.desc: Shows durability of items on item hover

features.name: Food Tooltips
features.desc: Shows food hunger & saturation on item hover

features.name: Cactus Item Protection
features.desc: Cactus destroying items doesn't really make sense. Enabling this prevents cactus from destroying items that run into it.

features.name: Challenger Mobs
features.desc: Challenger Mobs are an insanely customizable data-driven approach to boss-like mobs. See its dedicated Datapack Page using the submenu above to learn more about customzing this feature!

features.name: Feather Pluck
features.desc: Pluck feathers off of chickens with shears! There is a cool-down of approximately 5 minutes, but it doesn't hurt the chicken even though it looks like it does!

features.name: Entity Culling
features.desc: V-Tweaks offers a very powerful data-driven tool for allow you to disable specific mobs (or `entity_type` tag) from spawning in a particular dimension, biome or biome tag! See its dedicated Datapack Page using the submenu above to learn more about customzing this feature!

features.name: Peaceful Surface
features.desc: Prevents mobs spawning above sea level (configurable) on most nights, preventing you from having to deal with all the monsters. Only on new moons will mobs spawn on the surface, but you can otherwise find them in caves like usual. You can prevent certain mob spawns from being affected by this by using the `vtweaks:ignored_by_peaceful_surface` `entity_type` tag. You can control this feature in specific dimensions using the `vtweaks:peaceful_surface_blacklist_dims` tag.

features.name: Smaller Bees
features.desc: This tweak makes it so that bees appear to be smaller (exactly half their size, actually!). Logistically this changes nothing about them - their bounding and hit box is the same for your convenience, but they're sooo cute!

features.name: Pet Friendly Fire
features.desc: This tweak prevents pet owners (or all players - this is configurable) from hurting tamed pets so that you can keep your special friend alive and healthy!

features.name: Griefless Creepers
features.desc: When enabled, any explosion caused by a `#forge:creeper` (`entity_type`) will restore itself after time, even restoring Tile Entities and their data stored within!

features.name: Corpse Drops
features.desc: The item despawn mechanic is really unfair when you die, isn't it? By enabling this tweak items dropped by players on death will never despawn!

features.name: Better Feather Falling
features.desc: If you have a pair of boots with Feather Falling IV on them, all fall damage is negated. The damage you would have taken (literally - the amount of half-hearts you would have taken) is then applied to directly to your boots instead.

features.name: Anvil Recipes
features.desc: Create custom anvil recipes using a datapack! See its dedicated Datapack Page using the submenu above to learn more about customzing this feature!

features.name: Fluid Conversion Recipes
features.desc: Convert one item to another by throwing it into some fluid (now with JEI integration!). By default, V-Tweaks includes a set of recipes for converting Concrete Powder to Concrete, but check its dedicated Datapack Page using the submenu above to learn more about customzing this feature!

features.name: Item Repair
features.desc: Sets the repair costs of tools to a fixed 1XP, making it so you can keep your tools forever!

features.name: Disable Storms
features.desc: Completely disable thunderstorms, converting them all to normal rain on the fly!
